intro: Erodium jacquinianum, commonly known as the common stork's bill, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces distinctive, beak-like seed pods that split open when mature. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy habitats. Erodium jacquinianum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
